channel.title: Stockwatch - Key Events
channel.description: Real-time corporate announcements, deals, and financial results.

item.title: [MEHAI] Mehai Technology Ltd Receives Order for Shifting Registered Office from Rajasthan to West Bengal
item.description:
Mehai Technology Ltd has announced that it has received an order from the Regional Director, North-West regarding the shifting of its registered office from Rajasthan to West Bengal. This decision comes in accordance with section 13 of the Companies Act, 2013. The company can now proceed to make changes in the Master Data on the MCA Portal regarding the shifting of the registered office.

  • Mehai Technology Ltd has received an order for shifting its registered office from Rajasthan to West Bengal.
  • The order is in accordance with section 13 of the Companies Act, 2013.
  • The company can now proceed to make changes in the Master Data on the MCA Portal.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: Mehai Technology Ltd | Category: Business Update

item.title: [IGIL] International Gemmological Institute India Ltd Completes Acquisition of AGL Holdco Inc by Subsidiary
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

International Gemmological Institute India Ltd (IGI India) has announced the completion of the acquisition of AGL Holdco Inc by its step-down wholly owned subsidiary, International Gemmological Institute Inc (IGI USA). This acquisition was initially approved by the Board of Directors of IGI India in January 2026 and involved an investment in International Gemmological Institute BV (IGI Belgium), a wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI India, and investment by IGI Belgium in IGI USA. The acquisition of AGL Holdco Inc from Christopher P Smith and Helene Smith has resulted in AGL Holdco becoming a wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI USA and a step-down wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI Belgium and IGI India. Additionally, American Gemological Laboratories, LLC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of AGL Holdco, has become a step-down wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI USA, IGI Belgium, and IGI India.

  • International Gemmological Institute India Ltd completes the acquisition of AGL Holdco Inc by its step-down wholly owned subsidiary, International Gemmological Institute Inc
  • AGL Holdco Inc becomes wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI USA and step-down wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI Belgium and IGI India
  • American Gemological Laboratories, LLC becomes a step-down wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI USA, IGI Belgium, and IGI India

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: International Gemmological Institute India Ltd | Category: Acquisitions

item.title: [SOMATEX] Supreme Court Orders National Highways Authority of India to Deposit 50% of Awarded Amount in Arbitration Matter Involving Soma Textiles & Industries' Promoter
item.description:
The Hon'ble Supreme Court of India, in an arbitration-related matter involving Roadways Solutions India Infra Limited, the Promoter and Holding Company of Soma Textiles & Industries Ltd, has passed directions for the National Highways Authority of India to deposit 50% of the total awarded amount before the Registry of the Honâ€™ble Delhi High Court within eight weeks. The matter arises out of a Concession Agreement relating to the Vadodaraâ€” Mumbai Expressway Project (Packages VIII & IX). Soma Textiles & Industries Ltd is not a party to the proceedings and based on the information currently available, the order does not have any direct material impact on its financial or operational activities.

  • Supreme Court orders National Highways Authority of India to deposit 50% of the total awarded amount in an arbitration matter involving Soma Textiles & Industries' Promoter.
  • The matter pertains to disputes arising out of a Concession Agreement relating to the Vadodaraâ€” Mumbai Expressway Project (Packages VIII & IX).
  • Soma Textiles & Industries Ltd is not a party to the proceedings.
  • The awarded amount is Rs. 1,019,02,63,440/- plus interest aggregating to Rs. 1,197,72,60,596/- as on 09.02.2026.
  • Based on the information currently available, the order does not have any direct material impact on Soma Textiles & Industries Ltd's financial or operational activities.

Company: SOMA TEXTILES & INDUSTRIES LTD. | Category: Legal

item.title: [SPICEISL] Spice Islands Industries Ltd. exempted from Regulation 23(9) of SEBI (LODR) Regulation for Q1 2025
item.description:
Spice Islands Industries Limited, with a paid-up share capital of Rs. 4,30,00,000/- (Rupees Four Crores Thirty Lakhs Only) and a net worth of Rs. 2,35,70,000/- (Rupees Two Crore Thirty Five Lakhs Seventy Thousand Only) as on March 31, 2025, is exempted from the applicability of Regulation 23(9) of SEBI (LODR) Regulation for the quarter ended December 31, 2025. This exemption is due to the company's paid-up share capital and net worth being less than Rs. 10 Crores and Rs. 25 Crores, respectively. Consequently, the company is not required to submit 'Disclosures of the Related Party Transactions' as per Regulation 23(9) of the Listing Regulations.

  • Spice Islands Industries Ltd. is exempted from Regulation 23(9) of SEBI (LODR) Regulation for Q1 2025
  • The company's paid-up share capital and net worth are less than Rs. 10 Crores and Rs. 25 Crores, respectively
  • The company is not required to submit 'Disclosures of the Related Party Transactions' for Q1 2025

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: SPICE ISLANDS APPARELS LTD.-$ | Category: Business Update

item.title: [SHRIGANG] Shri Gang Industries Amends Code of Fair Disclosure of Unpublished Price Sensitive Information
item.description:
Shri Gang Industries & Allied Products Ltd. has amended its Code of practices and procedures for Fair Disclosure of Unpublished Price Sensitive Information under Regulation 8(1) read with Schedule A of SEBI (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations, 2015. The amendments have been approved by the Board at its meeting held on February 14, 2026. The Code aims to formulate a stated framework and policy for fair disclosure of events and occurrences that could probably have an impact in the price discovery, in the market for securities of the Company. The amended Code and every amendment thereto shall be promptly intimated to the stock exchanges where the securities are listed to promote transparency amongst the investors.

  • Shri Gang Industries & Allied Products Ltd. has amended its Code of practices and procedures for Fair Disclosure of Unpublished Price Sensitive Information.
  • The amendments have been approved by the Board at its meeting held on February 14, 2026.
  • The Code aims to formulate a stated framework and policy for fair disclosure of events and occurrences that could probably have an impact in the price discovery.
  • The amended Code and every amendment thereto shall be promptly intimated to the stock exchanges where the securities are listed to promote transparency amongst the investors.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: SHRI GANG INDUSTRIES AND ALLIED PRODUCTS LTD. | Category: Monthly Update

item.title: [ACEMEN] Ace Men Engg Works Ltd Board Meeting Postponed to February 18, 2026
item.description:
Ace Men Engg Works Ltd has informed the BSE that the meeting of the Board of Directors, originally scheduled on an unspecified date, has been postponed. The new date for the Board Meeting is Wednesday, February 18, 2026. The Board will consider and approve the business submitted vide intimation dated February 11, 2026.

  • Ace Men Engg Works Ltd Board Meeting postponed to February 18, 2026
  • The Board Meeting will consider and approve the business submitted vide intimation dated February 11, 2026

item.title: [LGT] LGT Business Connextions Ltd: Monitoring Agency Report Confirms Appropriate Utilization of Public Issue Proceeds
item.description:
The Monitoring Agency Report for the quarter ended December 31, 2025 for LGT Business Connextions Limited, issued by Infomerics Ratings Limited, confirms the appropriate utilization of proceeds from the public issue. The report was submitted in accordance with Regulation 32(6) of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 and Regulation 162A of SEBI (Issue of Capital and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2018. The proceeds from the public issue have been utilized for the objects mentioned in the offer document. The report also declares that there is no deviation from the objects and the range of deviation is nil.

  • Monitoring Agency Report confirms appropriate utilization of public issue proceeds
  • Report submitted in accordance with SEBI regulations
  • No deviation from the objects, range of deviation is nil
  • Infomerics Ratings Limited is the Monitoring Agency
  • Report issued for the quarter ended December 31, 2025

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: LGT Business Connextions Ltd | Category: Quarterly Result

item.description:

item.title: [MANSIFIN] Mansi Finance (Chennai) Ltd Reports Q3 Results with 12.82% YoY Growth in Total Comprehensive Income
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Mansi Finance (Chennai) Ltd, a leading financial company, has announced its financial results for the quarter ended December 31, 2025. The company reported a total comprehensive income of INR 830.46 crores, representing a 12.82% year-over-year growth. The revenue from operations stood at INR 209.02 crores, while the profit before tax was INR 104.74 crores. The company's total expenses were INR 113.30 crores, and the earnings per equity share were INR 106.70. The financial results have been approved by the Board of Directors and reviewed by the Audit Committee.

  • Total comprehensive income grew by 12.82% YoY
  • Revenue from operations stood at INR 209.02 crores
  • Profit before tax was INR 104.74 crores
  • Total expenses were INR 113.30 crores
  • Earnings per equity share were INR 106.70

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: MANSI FINANCE (CHENNAI) LTD. | Category: Quarterly Result

item.title: [EVERESTO] Everest Organics Ltd Submits Unaudited Financial Results for Q3 & Nine Months Ended Dec 31, 2025
item.description:
Everest Organics Limited has submitted its unaudited financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The company reported a sales turnover of Rs 5026.85 Lakhs for the quarter, with domestic sales at Rs. 3970.75 Lakhs and export sales at Rs. 1056.10 Lakhs. The company operates in one reportable business segment: Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs) and Intermediates. There were 2,63,157 Equity Share Warrants outstanding on 31.12.2025. The financial results were reviewed and recommended by the Audit Committee and approved by the Board of Directors.

  • Sales turnover of Rs 5026.85 Lakhs for the quarter
  • Domestic sales of Rs. 3970.75 Lakhs and export sales of Rs. 1056.10 Lakhs
  • Operates in the Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs) and Intermediates segment
  • 2,63,157 Equity Share Warrants outstanding on 31.12.2025
  • Financial results reviewed and approved by the Audit Committee and Board of Directors

Company: EVEREST ORGANICS LTD. | Category: Quarterly Result
